edu.rit.util

Class BitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.BitSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitSetVbl

    public class BitSet
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class BitSet provides a set of integers from 0 to a given upper bound. The set elements are stored in a bitmap representation. The largest integer that can be stored is N−1, where N is specified as a constructor argument.

    Note: Class BitSet is not multiple thread safe.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitSet

        public BitSet()
        Construct a new uninitialized set. This constructor is for use only by object streaming.

      • BitSet

        public BitSet(int max)
        Construct a new empty set. The set can hold elements from 0 through N−1 inclusive, where N is the smallest multiple of 32 greater than or equal to max.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum number of elements (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if max < 1.

      • BitSet

        public BitSet(BitSet set)
        Construct a new set that is a copy of the given set.
        Parameters:
        set - Set to copy.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if set is null.

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determine if this set is empty.
        Returns:
        True if this set is empty, false otherwise.

        Returns the number of elements in this set.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int elem)
        Determine if this set contains the given element. If elem is not in the range 0 .. N−1, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        True if this set contains elem, false otherwise.

      • add

        public BitSet add(int elem)
        Add the given element to this set. If elem is not in the range 0 .. N−1, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • add

        public BitSet add(int lb,
         int ub)
        Add all elements in the given range to this set. All elements from lb through ub−1 inclusive are added to this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not added. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • remove

        public BitSet remove(int elem)
        Remove the given element from this set. If elem is not in the range 0 .. N−1, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • remove

        public BitSet remove(int lb,
            int ub)
        Remove all elements in the given range from this set. All elements from lb through ub−1 inclusive are removed from this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not removed. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • flip

        public BitSet flip(int elem)
        Flip the given element. If this set contains elem, it is removed; if this set does not contain elem, it is added. If elem is not in the range 0 .. N−1, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • flip

        public BitSet flip(int lb,
          int ub)
        Flip all elements in the given range. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are flipped. If this set contains such an element, it is removed; if this set does not contain such an element, it is added. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not flipped. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • isSubsetOf

        public boolean isSubsetOf(BitSet set)
        Determine if this set is a subset of the given set. This is so if every element of this set is also an element of the given set.

        It is assumed that N is the same for both sets; if not, the behavior of the isSubsetOf() method is not specified.

        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        True if this set is a subset of the given set, false otherwise.

      • union

        public BitSet union(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the union of itself and the given set. The union consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set or both.

        It is assumed that N is the same for both sets; if not, the behavior of the union() method is not specified.

        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • intersection

        public BitSet intersection(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the intersection of itself and the given set. The intersection consists of all elements that appear in this set and the given set.

        It is assumed that N is the same for both sets; if not, the behavior of the intersection() method is not specified.

        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • difference

        public BitSet difference(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the difference of itself and the given set. The difference consists of all elements that appear in this set and not in the given set.

        It is assumed that N is the same for both sets; if not, the behavior of the difference() method is not specified.

        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • symmetricDifference

        public BitSet symmetricDifference(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the symmetric difference of itself and the given set. The symmetric difference consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set, but not both.

        It is assumed that N is the same for both sets; if not, the behavior of the symmetricDifference() method is not specified.

        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • forEachItemDo

        public void forEachItemDo(IntAction action)
        Perform the given action on each element in this set. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given action's run() method is called, passing in the element.

        Warning: If the action adds elements to or removes elements from the set, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Parameters:
        action - Action.

      • forEachItemDo

        public <R> R forEachItemDo(IntActionResult<R> action)
        Perform the given action on each element in this set and return a result. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given action's run() method is called, passing in the element. After all the elements have been processed, the given action's result() method is called, and its result is returned.

        Warning: If the action adds elements to or removes elements from the set, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Result data type.
        Parameters:
        action - Action.
        Returns:
        Result of processing all the set elements.

      • removeEachItemIf

        public void removeEachItemIf(IntPredicate predicate)
        Evaluate the given predicate on, and possibly remove, each element in this set. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given predicate's test() method is called, passing in the element. If the test() method returns true, the element is removed from this set.

        Warning: If the predicate adds elements to or removes elements from the set, other than by returning true, the removeEachItemIf() method's behavior is not specified.

        Parameters:
        predicate - Predicate.
